titlestmt.titleproper: Wyncie King and Hortense Flexner King collection 1904-1978 1930-1960
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Wyncie King and Hortense Flexner King collection

bioghist.p: Wyncie King (1874-1961) was a noted illustrator and caricaturist for many leading American magazines and newspapers, including the Louisville Herald, the New York Evening World, the New York Times Book Review, Life, and the Saturday Evening Post. He was well known in Philadelphia art circles and he and his wife, the writer and poet Hortense Flexner (1885-1973), collaborated on several children's books.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of drawings of Wyncie King and correspondence of Wyncie King and Hortense Flexner. Included are cards and letters to friends and family carrying King's drawings; illustrated envelopes; caricatures of celebrities, such as Rachmaninov, Hemingway, and Bertrand Russell; caricatures of several Bryn Mawr professors; and several unpublished manuscripts of children's books by Hortense Flexner.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: A paper finding aid is available in the repository.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: William F. Ekstrom Library, University of Louisville: Hortense Flexner (King) papers; Archives of American Art, Smithsonian Institution: Wyncie King papers.
